doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with William Stanton held on July 16, 1986
doc.abstracts: In July 1986, William Stanton was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1983 to 1991, Mr. Stanton worked in the following areas: in the office of external affair as senior advisor to the vice president (1983-1986) and as acting vice president (1987); and in the office of the president as a counselor (1986-1991). Beginning in 1964, he spent 18 years as representative of the eleventh Congressional District of Ohio in the Congress of the United States. His transcript concerns the House Banking and Finance Committee and its relation to the World Bank Group.
